attributes.action: Stop parking increases in Derbys. All day parking increases from £1 a day to £4.
attributes.background: Ilkeston is a small town in Derbyshire. People who work there are paying £1 a day to park at the moment but the local council are to increase this to £4 a day. A 300% increase. It will be an extra £60 a month for me and others to park for the day to go to work.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. This is the responsibility of Derbyshire County Council.

You could raise your issue with a local councillor, who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillor

Your local council also has a petitions process - you can find out more about it here: http://www.derbyshire.gov.uk/council/have_your_say/petitions/
